tag_list: tapit, tapitnfc, andrew-davis, jamie-conyngham, james-darcy, david-kainer
overview:
Andrew Davis is a co-founder of Australian tech start-up, Tapit.

Andrew started his professional career in 2004 with a role in the mail room with global company, McCann Erickson (NYSE: IPG).

Following 6 months of delivering mail he was offered to work at media agency, Universal McCann on the Coca-Cola account. Andrew ended up working his way through the company in various roles such as a media buyer, media planner, digital planner / buyer and finally Client Service Manager whereby he led the Microsoft / Xbox Australia media business for 3 years.

After running the Microsoft business, Andrew in 2010 joined another IPG company called Initiative as National Digital Director in which his core responsibilities were to lead the digital media offering for clients such as Hyundai, Kia & Revlon.

In 2011, Andrew with Jamie Conyngham, James D’arcy and David Kainer founded Near Field Communication business, Tapit.

Andrew’s role within Tapit begun as Agency Director with primary responsibilities of establishing and growing relationships with companies that can benefit using Tapit technology for the purpose of marketing and advertising. Since August, 2012 Andrew has been tasked with leading Tapit internal operations from production, workflow, supplier partnerships and project management ensuring Tapit is benchmarked as best of breed when it comes to NFC content delivery.

Andrew also leads all branding and marketing programs for Tapit, creating the brand from scratch in March 2011, Tapit is now seen as a world leading brand in the NFC content delivery space.

video_embeds.description: Presentation by Tapit Co-founders Jamie Conyngham & Andrew Davis talking about the magical experiences afforded to consumers by using Near Field Communications.
